unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The Ministry of Power has reported significant progress in the nationwide smart meter deployment program. As of 20/10/2024, over 5 million smart meters have been installed in households and businesses across various states, including Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar.
normalised: New Delhi – The Ministry of Power has reported significant progress in the nationwide smart meter deployment program. As of twentieth october two thousand and twenty four, over five million smart meters have been installed in households and businesses across various states, including Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar.

unnormalised: This initiative, aimed at modernizing the energy distribution infrastructure, facilitates real-time energy consumption monitoring, reduces power theft, and enables consumers to better manage their electricity usage. "The adoption of smart meters is crucial for achieving our vision of a 'Digital India' and a sustainable energy future," stated Mr. Sharma, Secretary, Ministry of Power, during a press briefing at 11:00 hrs today.
normalised: This initiative, aimed at modernizing the energy distribution infrastructure, facilitates real-time energy consumption monitoring, reduces power theft, and enables consumers to better manage their electricity usage. "The adoption of smart meters is crucial for achieving our vision of a 'Digital India' and a sustainable energy future," stated Mister Sharma, Secretary, Ministry of Power, during a press briefing at eleven zero zero hours today.

unnormalised: Power distribution companies (Discoms) like Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited and BSES Yamuna Power Limited are actively participating in the rollout. The project is expected to be completed by 31/12/2025. Preliminary data indicates an average reduction of 15% in Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses in areas with deployed smart meters. The next phase focuses on expanding the program to rural areas, including villages in Rajasthan, with deployment expected to start around 09:00 hrs on 01/11/2024.
normalised: Power distribution companies (Discoms) like Tata Power Delhi Distribution Limited and B S E S Yamuna Power Limited are actively participating in the rollout. The project is expected to be completed by thirty first december two thousand and twenty five. Preliminary data indicates an average reduction of fifteen percent in Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses in areas with deployed smart meters. The next phase focuses on expanding the program to rural areas, including villages in Rajasthan, with deployment expected to start around nine zero zero hours on first november two thousand and twenty four.
